item.title: earthquake forecast
item.description: How to achieve earthquake forecasts? Earthquake weather? Earthquake climate? What do we need to do next? Physics-based models capable of [[notes/data assimilation|data assimilation]] good approximation of the physics we want to model upscaling?

item.title: Microseismicity in South Island, New Zealand
item.description: Seismicity rate changes when the stress state in the crust changes. Both seismicity and geodetic data are readily available to us.

item.title: A Taiwanese survival guide in Switzerland
item.description: Food The soy milk in Migros is the best soy milk you can get. The same applied to Migros’ seiden tofu.

item.title: BBQ recipes
item.description: Salt and pepper pork slice This grill pork slice is without soy sauce. One can taste the spice and herbs better.

item.title: Better built environments
item.description: Build the built environment in a less intrusive way 鋼構攔砂壩 穿透式的鋼構壩，在不妨礙生態系運作的情況下，達到避災減災的目的。「降雨將上游的土砂往下游帶，達到補充海岸泥沙，原是自然運作的法則。」許文奕說，而穿透式的壩體，就可讓顆粒較小、沖刷力道相對小的砂石往下游帶。 Biodiverse gardens Copper mining directly from brine instead of digging it From the Economist

item.title: Chartier-SRL-2019-SHERIFS
item.description: SHERIFS: Open-Source Code for Computing Earthquake Rates in Fault Systems and Constructing Hazard Models Authors: Thomas Chartier, Oona Scotti, and Hélène Lyon-Caen Source code Notes Seismic Hazard and Earthquake Rates In Fault Systems Adapt the main philosophy of [[notes/UCERF3|UCERF3]] Inputs Fault geometry and basic descriptions Target [[notes/statistical seismology#Magnitude-frequency distribution|magnitude-frequency distribution]] shape of fault seismicity This is expressed as the ratio of magnitudes occurring in the background hypothesis input.

item.title: Coulomb rate-and-state model
item.description: Combining Coulomb stress change with [[notes/Dieterich-JGR-1994|Dieterich1994]] to calculate rate change after sudden stress change. Reference seismicity rate r changes when a change in stress $\dot\tau$ occur and reach a new rate R as

item.title: Curriculum Vitae
item.description: Summary Experienced seismologist in multiple fields, including waveform and data analysis, body- and surface-wave tomography, statistical seismology, and earthquake cycle modeling.

item.title: data assimilation
item.description: Calibrate numerical model using the observed values. Inspiration [[notes/Ylona van Dinther|Ylona van Dinther]], Hans R Künsch, Andreas Fichtner, Ensemble data assimilation for earthquake sequences: probabilistic estimation and forecasting of fault stresses, Geophysical Journal International, Volume 217, Issue 3, June 2019, Pages 1453–1478, doi: 10.

item.title: data visualization
item.description: Basics [[notes/Nicolas P Rougier|Nicolas P. Rougier]], Droettboom M, Bourne PE (2014) Ten Simple Rules for Better Figures. PLoS Comput Biol 10(9): e1003833.

item.title: Dieterich.JGR.1994
item.description: A constitutive law for rate of earthquake production and its application to earthquake clustering Authors: [[notes/James H Dieterich|James H. Dieterich]] Source Notes The essential concept of the analysis is the treatment of a seismically active volume of the Earth as having a population of sources that nucleate successive earthquakes to produce observed seismicity.

item.title: Earthquake Model of the Middle East
item.description: Objective Looking into ways of incorporate fault information into hazard calculations. Do different tools gives completely different result? Now it sounds awfully similar to what Fault2SHA want to do.

item.title: Earthquake Simulator
item.description: Softwares Virtual Quake An earthquake simulator created by John B. Rundle. It has great meshing function but simple failure criterion and no frictional evolution law.

item.title: European Seismic Hazard Model 2020
item.description: Model components Inputs Historical catalog (1000-1899) Instrumental catalog (1900-2014) Active crustal faults and subduction zones Tectonic regionalizations Seismogenic source models Area source model Active faults and background seismicity model Database of individual seismogenic sources Subduction zones Deep Seismicity Sources Ground Motion Models A whole different world that I do not trespass.

item.title: Everyday tools
item.description: Brain power saving Because there are so many things to worry about already. espanso Text expansion for terminals and everyday typing.

item.title: Failure Resume
item.description: Since I am not the [[notes/My Hero Academics|hero type]], might as well be my own anti-hero🤡 2022 Rejected by LLNL without a second round for a postdoc position Paper on [[notes/prj-eqsim|seismicity modeling]] got rejected by GRL Failed the interview of a postdoc position in Uni Plymouth 2021 Didn’t go to any conference 2020 Attend the text-based EGU to present the [[notes/prj-tempmatch|NZ seismicity project]] and got next-to-zero response.

item.title: Field.SRL.2019
item.description: How Physics-Based [[notes/earthquake simulator|Earthquake Simulator]]s Might Help Improve [[notes/earthquake forecast|Earthquake Forecast]]s Author: Edward H. Field Journal: SRL Opinion Abstract Questions have persisted on the usefulness of physics-based earthquake simulators with respect to forecasting earthquakes, due mostly to the inevitable assumptions, approximations, and uncertainties.

item.title: Fortran How-to
item.description: Improve your Fortran 77 programs using some Fortran 90 features by Ryo Furue Arrays Referring sections: array([lower]:[upper][:stride]) If no lower or upper is given, the default is the dimension of the array.

item.description: Gilbert Strang is, above all his academic works, a charming teacher that simply likes the wonder of math. He has great courses in linear algebra and calculus freely available online.

item.description: Handbook There’s no way around not coding in research these days. Patrick Mineault who was a neuroscientist and software engineer create this web book: The Good Research Code Handbook

item.title: Huberman said
item.description: Neuroscience Protocols Duration, path and outcome Our brains always try to figure out these three things. Making clear of these aspect make us feel more assured and calm.

item.title: Jackson-PhilosTransA-2006
item.description: Fatal attraction: living with earthquakes, the growth of villages into megacities, and earthquake vulnerability in the modern world Authors: James Jackson Source: Philosophical Transaction A Abstract The great earthquake belt which stretches from the Mediterranean through the Middle East into Central Asia results from the ongoing collision between the Eurasian plate and the African, Arabian and Indian plates to the south.

item.title: Latex how-to
item.description: I may not use a micro-filled Latex package ever again after the [[notes/How to graduate in D-ERDW|doctoral thesis]]. But here are some pretty neat tricks I learned along the way.

item.title: Magnitude-frequency distribution
item.description: The distribution of earthquake sizes is an important quantity, particularly for seismic hazard assessment. Because it tells you the probability of large but infrequent earthquake if you can capture and measure the small ones.

item.title: Making a github-hosted website
item.description: I use Jekyll for static-site generation, combining with Atom for git and Obsidian for writing. Here are the resources I use to pimp this site.

item.title: Making maps with Python
item.description: In my [[notes/prj-tempmatch|NZ project]], I decided to plot my results entirely in Python to keep the pipeline simple. Turned out if you can fix the projection, you are half-way there.

item.title: modeling earthquakes
item.description: Modeling seismicity using statistical distributions [[notes/ETAS|ETAS]] Modeling seismicity using fixed faults Discrete earthquake simulators RSQSim from [[notes/James H Dieterich|JH Dieterich]] and KB Richards-Dinger Dynamic rupture models LMU group [[notes/SEAS|SEAS]] benchmarks Single-fault multiple earthquake cycle Rheology and frictional properties studies Modeling seismicity in the continuum regime See the publications from Taras Gerya group: Luca dal Zilio, [[notes/Ylona van Dinther|Ylona van Dinther]] Still in 2-D megathrusts

item.title: My Hero Academics
item.description: Self-promotion is something I struggle with for as long as I have memories. Imagine how bad I usually feel in a conference.

item.title: NumPy
item.description: Resources From Python to NumPy by [[notes/Nicolas P Rougier|Nicolas P. Rougier]] How-to Broadcasting NumPy fundamentals The term broadcasting describes how NumPy treats arrays with different shapes during arithmetic operations.

Or Schynige Platte – Männdlenen 2344m - Faulhorn - First Hiking around Oeschinensee Along the Sentierone in the Verzasca Valley Via Engiadina from Maloja to Silvaplana Around the Gastlosen High Route Saas Fee–Grächen From Fuorn Pass to Lü Along the Planet Trail from Saint-Luc to Zinal From the Gotthard to Bedretto Valley Sentiero Cristalina Pizol Five-lake hike (September 2021) ^Pizol5lake Aletsch Glacier Trail In the Jura region to Creux du Van Along the Brienzergrat Wildhaus-Säntis

item.title: On cooking
item.description: I started to cook, or thinking about cooking, during college. It was not because I finally left home. The college dorm and the shoebox studios for students and singles strongly forbid any kind of cooking.

item.description: Full cycle of open data The FAIR principle: Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable Methods are results, too Inspiration

item.title: OpenQuake
item.description: OpenQuake is a Python package created by the Global Earthquake Model foundation (GEM) for producing [[notes/PSHA|PSHA]] models. It does not support [[notes/python#Conda|conda]] install however.

item.title: Pandas
item.description: I am unable to leave pandas because I work with catalogs. But I hear good things about xarray Basic Dataframes Change column name: emme14.

item.title: Parallel Computing
item.description: Intro The tutorial from the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory And the one from ETH Parallel computer taxonomy by Flynn SISD: Base case of a single instruction stream and single data stream SIMD Single instruction: all processing units execute the same instruction at any given clock cycle Multiple data: Each processing unit can operate on a different data element MISD: multiband filter, code cracking MIMD: every computer now Jargons A node = a computer in a box execution units hardware threads Speedup and scalability Amdahl’s law Strong scaling If a fraction $p$ of your code execution time can be parallelized, then ideally the best speedup from parallelize it is $\frac{1}{1-p}$.

item.title: Personal knowledge management
item.description: During the pandemic, the craze of “personal knowledge management” took off. Loosely, PKM tools are referred to the note keeping apps that let you reference portions of the note I happened to try the famed web-based note service Roam Research.

item.title: Probabilistic seismic hazard assessment
item.description: Basic Large-magnitude earthquakes dominant the risk but are the most difficult to constrain Components Source models Best talk from the Fault2SHA channel by Graeme Weatherill

item.title: Publicly Clueless
item.description: I am a person that does not like writing and doesn’t write well. Of all the research works my least favorite is writing.

item.title: Python
item.description: Basic Add path 1 2 import sys sys.path.append('path/to/folder') Conda Remove tarballs, cache, etc: conda clean -a Managing environment create: conda create --name myenv python=3.

item.description: Rate-and-state friction is a friction law born from tribology experiments. Established by friction experiments and theory works from [[notes/James H Dieterich|James H.

item.title: Rewild
item.description: Return the land in its natural form Removal of the dam on the Klamath river in Oregon, USA. The dams are owned by PacifiCorp The largest dam-removal in US history The Economist’s report on dam removal presents both opinions from downstream Aboriginal communities and inland conservatives.

item.description: Finite-frequency tomography For my master thesis with Prof Shu-Huei Hung, I work with finite-frequency tomography to image the mantle below Basin and Range province, USA.

item.title: Simulate earthquake sequences in 3-D fault systems
item.description: How to create a [[notes/modeling earthquakes|synthetic seismic sequence]]? Surely one can use the statistics to generate one. But we know plates move and faults slide.

item.title: Simulation Science
item.description: Choosing a model is the same as choosing a base functions. It’s the wavelength you choose to observe and describe the phenomena.

item.title: Statistical Seismilogy
item.description: Catalogs Harvard globalcentroid moment tensor catalog CMT solutions of global earthquakes M>5. The ISC-GEM catalog 1904-2018, magnitude 5 and above for continental region and 5.

item.title: Strain rate to Seismicity Rate
item.description: Does the rate of surface deformation proportional to the rate of earthquakes? Can change in strain rate translate to change in seismicity rate?

item.title: Template Matching
item.description: Using known event waveform to systematically search for weaker events. Famous usages include David Shelly’s tremor research in Japan and Zhigang Peng’s works about dynamically triggered events is various places.

item.title: TMUX
item.description: 大抄 New session with a name: tmux new -s foo List alive session, there can be multiple sessions: tmux ls

item.title: Uniform California Earthquake Rupture Forecast 3
item.description: The third Uniform California Earthquake Rupture Forecast (UCERF3) is the PSHA model of California. But because of the extensive fault and seismicity data available, the model is able to present the possible ruptures instead of low-activity area that rely on magnitude-frequency relations to estimate the hazard.
